camera module¶

class camera.Camera(device: int, colorspace='rgb', parent=None)¶

Bases: object

The Base class for handling USB camera

create_videowriter(filename: str, codec: str)¶

Creates an opencv VideoWriter object

Parameters

  • filename (str) – Filename of video

  • codec (str) – Codec

decode_fourcc(v: float) → str¶

Decode the return value.

Parameters

v (float) – [description]

Returns

Fourcc such as YUYV, MJPG, etc.

Return type

str

Examples

>>> decoder_fourcc(1448695129.0)
>>> "YUYV"

Returns

width, height, fps and fourcc of camera

abstract get_supported_fourcc()¶
abstract get_supported_fps()¶
abstract get_supported_params()¶
abstract get_supported_size()¶
init()¶
open()¶

Creates an opencv VideoCapture object.

open_error()¶

Shows error meesage, finishes the all program.

This method will be called when the PC cannot detect an USB camera,

read_frame()¶

Reads one frame from the connected camera.

If a flag for the frame set true, One frame is read from the camera as the type of numpy.ndarray. To rearrange the channel’s order, convert the frame from BRG to RGB if the colorspace is set to color (by default). If grayscale, the frame will be convertd to 1 channel grayscale.

abstract set_param_default()¶
abstract set_parameter()¶
set_properties(fourcc: str, width: int, height: int, fps: float)¶

Sets the current width, height, fps and fourcc of camera.

Parameters

  • fourcc (str) – Fourcc

  • width (int) – Frame width

  • height (int) – Frame heigth

  • fps (float) – Frame FPS

Creates an opencv VideoWriter object to start recording.

stop_frame()¶

Stop Reading frame

stop_recording()¶

Finishes recording to save the video file.
